article.headline: Tennessee State 75, Eastern Illinois 68
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Jeremy Jackson scored a career-high 23 points to lead Tennessee State to a 75-68 victory over Eastern Illinois on Thursday night. Roshaun Bowens scored 18 points and grabbed nine rebounds for the Tigers (5-17, 4-7 Ohio Valley Conference), while Bruce Price added 14 points and five assists. Jesse Mackinson led the Panthers (5-17, 3-9) with 19 points and seven rebounds, and Josh Gomes had 17 points. Eastern Illinois jumped out to an early lead in a game that stayed close throughout the first half. Tennessee State took its first lead at 15-13 with 12:07 left in the first half on a 3-pointer by Garrett Richardson, who had nine points. The Tigers never lost the lead, holding a 32-27 advantage at halftime. Tennessee State eventually led by 66-53 with 3:51 left to play before the Panthers mounted a comeback. A layup by Gomes cut Tennessee State's lead to 69-66 with 1:21 left, but Price hit four free throws in the final minute to seal the win. Both teams shot well from the field, with the Tigers hitting 52 percent compared to 44.2 percent for the Panthers. Tennessee State was much more effective from 3-point range, hitting 9-of-15 from beyond the arc to just 4-of-19 for Eastern Illinois.
